results.title: New life new country
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Fatma Coskun and ACMI
results.brief_description: Fatma Coskun came from a small village amongst the mountains of Corun. However, financial hardships drove her and her husband to Australia to start a new life. Despite a major setback at the beginning of their journey, Fatma and her family consider themselves very fortunate to have settled in Australia.

results.title: Simple looms. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and John Gray
results.brief_description: A how-to-do it program intended to provide the viewer with the confidence, skill and interest to try it for themselves. Suggestions are given on how inspiration and ideas may be drawn from the natural world for weaving design themes.

results.title: Half and Half
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “School’s Out”.
Prejudice, language and cultural differences are among the difficulties faced in school by migrant children. After school the problems are more pronounced: they feel halfway between their parents’ culture and the Australian lifestyle

results.title: Wyperfeld
results.brief_description: Wyperfeld National Park in North-western Victoria: its birds, animals, wildflowers and trees. The Ranger travels through the sand dunes of the Mallee country, stopping at a bore to pump water. Birds gather to drink - galahs, crested pigeons, ringneck parrots, honeyeaters, ravens and white cockatoos. Kangaroos, emus and the bushy-tailed possum abound amongst stands of red gums and Murray pine, and wildflowers seen include the white ever-lasting and Austral beauties. Bird watchers visiting the park study the beautiful Mallee fowl. Camera, editing and script: David Corke. Music: George Dreyfus Assistance and location recording: Peter Bruce. Park Ranger: Alec Campbell.

results.title: Trespass on Summerland
results.creator_credit: Brighton Grammar School (Vic.). Film Makers Club
results.brief_description: A few boys enjoying a camping holiday are evicted from their camp by an irate farmer. They later save his son trapped on a precipitous cliff face. (Awards: 2nd prize at the International Contest for Young Film Makers, Milan, Italy)

results.title: Toronto jazz
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Toronto is regarded as the third largest jazz centre in North America. This film features a cross-section of jazz bands of that city: the Lenny Breau Trio, the Don Thompson Quintet and the Alf Jones Quartet. Their styles show creative self-expression, hard work, and improvisation.
